docs.summary: The ConsentPolicy API is used to perform actions related to the user's allowed cookies and 3rd-party data transfer, such as for GDPR or CCPA purposes.
description: The consent policy helps you comply with [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/preparing-your-wix-site-for-the-gdpr) and [CCPA](https://support.wix.com/en/article/preparing-your-wix-site-for-ccpa) regulations and lets your users
control their information. The site owner sets up the site consent policy and cookie consent banners in

the site's [Privacy Center](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Open%20Privacy%20Center&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fcookie-consent-settings-app?referralInfo=corvid-docs).
To use the ConsentPolicy API, import `{ consentPolicy }` from the `wix-window` module:
```javascript
import { consentPolicy } from 'wix-window';
The APIs in `wix-window.ConsentPolicy` can only be used in front-end code.

docs.summary: Gets the visitor's consent policy regarding allowed cookies and 3rd-party data transfer, such as for GDPR or CCPA purposes.
description: The `getCurrentConsentPolicy()` function returns the
consent policy details of the visitor, meaning, which cookies the visitor allows and whether data transfer
to 3rd parties is allowed.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixUsers.getCurrentConsentPolicy()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-users/getcurrentconsentpolicy#migration-instructions).

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the consent policy is changed.

docs.summary:
Sets the function that runs
when a visitor's consent policy was changed using
[`setConsentPolicy()`](#setConsentPolicy) or reset using
[`resetConsentPolicy()`](#resetConsentPolicy).
description: Use the `onConsentPolicyChanged()` function for code you want to run after
the visitor's current consent policy was changed using
[`setConsentPolicy()`](#setConsentPolicy) or reset using
[`resetConsentPolicy()`](#resetConsentPolicy).
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixUsers.onConsentPolicyChanged()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-users/onconsentpolicychanged#migration-instructions).
Usually, you want to call the `onConsentPolicyChanged()` function in the **masterpage.js** file in the
code panel so that the `onConsentPolicyChanged()` event handler runs no matter which
page on your site is used to change the policy.

examples.title: Run code when a visitor's consent policy changed

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - When the reset is complete.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
Removes the current policy from the visitor's browser
and resets the visitor's consent policy to the default policy for the site.
description: The `resetConsentPolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the policy is reset.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixUsers.resetConsentPolicy()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-users/resetconsentpolicy#migration-instructions).

examples.title: Reset a visitor's consent policy
body: console.log("The policy is now set to the default site policy.");

params.name: policy
params.doc: An object representing the cookies of the visitor's consent policy.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - All the details of the visitor's consent policy, including if the the current policy is the default site policy and the policy's allowed cookies.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
Sets the current visitor's consent policy
regarding allowed cookies and data transfer to 3rd parties,
such as for GDPR or CCPA purposes.
description: The `setConsentPolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
consent policy details of the visitor.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixUsers.setConsentPolicy()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-users/setconsentpolicy#migration-instructions).
You can use the [`onConsentPolicyChanged()`](#onConsentPolicyChanged) event to listen for
changes made when a visitor changes their consent policy with `setConsentPolicy()`. Handle
the policy change accordingly in the event handler's [ConsentPolicyChangedHandler callback function](#ConsentPolicyChangedHandler).
Changes to the consent policy take affect after the page is refreshed.

params.name: event
params.doc: The event that occurred when the consent policy changed.

docs.summary: Function that runs when a user's consent policy was changed using [`setConsentPolicy()`](#setConsentPolicy).
The event that occurred when the consent policy changed.

examples.title: Run code when a a user's consent policy changed

docs.summary: The current user's consent policy settings.
description: An object containing the consent policy cookie settings, by type, of the user currently viewing the site.

examples.title: Get the current user's consent policy

members.name: essential
members.doc: Consent for mandatory cookies for Wix websites, such as for security cookies. Wix places these cookies on your device and these cookies do not require user consent. Always `true`.

members.name: functional
members.doc: Consent for cookies placed on the user's device that "remember" user settings to improve user experience. For example, an indication that the user dismissed a popup. The default is `true`.

members.name: analytics
members.doc: Consent for cookies used for analytics, such as Wix analytics, Google Analytics, Yandex Metrica, and so on. The default is `true`.

members.name: advertising
members.doc: Consent for cookies used for advertising purposes. This includes 3rd-party scripts and pixels that may potentially place advertising cookies on the device (such as Twitter page view and Facebook Pixel). The default is `true`.

members.name: dataToThirdParty
members.doc: Consent for a user's personal data to be transferred to a 3rd party (such as Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, and FullStory). The default is `true`.

docs.summary: The complete details of the current user's consent policy.
description: An object containing all the details about the consent policy of the user currently viewing the site.
This is returned in the Promise of the `setConsentPolicy()` function.

members.name: defaultPolicy
members.doc: Whether the policy is the default consent policy set by the site owner. If `true`, either the user has not set a policy or the site owner has reset the policy.

members.name: policy
members.doc: An object representing the user's current consent policy.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: If a cookie exists in the browser defining the current consent policy, the date the policy was set. Otherwise, undefined.
